data.message: Hi Facebook. So I have a joint account with my husband, and I would like to change the birthday on the account to my birthday. I have tried to do this several times over the past 4 years or so, but it's stuck on his bday. It's nice that I can change my gender, very PC. But why can I not also change my birthday?

replies.message:
Hi, Rachel. We don't allow joint accounts. Additionally, you can only sign up for one Facebook account per email address.
Since each account belongs to one person, we require everyone to use their authentic name on their account. This way, you always know who you're connecting with. Learn more about our name policies: http://bit.ly/2edhqW8. -Rhea

Facebook, sounds great. We only have one email account tied to the Facebook account. You still didn't answer my question though about why I cannot change my birthday to represent the person who uses the account.
my friends is always happy t0 my facebook!!!
